required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Chart Review of OZURDEX® in Patients With Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective chart review study will describe the history of patients with retinal disease with macular edema to whom OZURDEX® (dexamethasone intravitreal implant) is administered, and assess treatment patterns and visual outcomes. OZURDEX® was previously administered according to general clinical practice.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 to 26 weeks (wks) following last injection (up to 6.5 months)
primary_outcome.description: BCVA was assessed using the Snellen eye chart converted to Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study number of lines ranging from 0 (worst) to 20 (best). The peak mean change in BCVA was calculated using the most improved number of lines read correctly between 2 and 26 weeks following the last available injection of OZURDEX® - the number of lines read correctly at Baseline. A positive change from Baseline indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Mean Change From Baseline in Central Retinal Thickness (CRT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 to 26 weeks following last injection (up to 6.5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT), a laser based non-invasive diagnostic system providing high-resolution imaging sections of the retina, was performed in the study eye. The peak mean change was the maximum change from Baseline in CRT at 2 to 26 weeks following the last available injection of OZURDEX®. A negative change from Baseline indicated improvement.

arm_group.description: Patients with macular edema previously treated with dexamethasone intravitreal implant (OZURDEX®) according to general clinical practice.

intervention.description: Dexamethasone Intravitreal Implant (OZURDEX®) previously administered according to general clinical practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Retinal disease involving macular edema
- Received at least one OZURDEX® injection
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Patients with macular edema previously treated with dexamethasone intravitreal implant (OZURDEX®) according to general clinical practice.

outcome.title: Peak Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA)
outcome.description: BCVA was assessed using the Snellen eye chart converted to Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study number of lines ranging from 0 (worst) to 20 (best). The peak mean change in BCVA was calculated using the most improved number of lines read correctly between 2 and 26 weeks following the last available injection of OZURDEX® - the number of lines read correctly at Baseline. A positive change from Baseline indicated improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 to 26 weeks (wks) following last injection (up to 6.5 months)
outcome.population: All participants with BCVA observations available following the last OZURDEX® injection from 2 to 26 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
